subject: Re: [tosdr:1005] [site suggestion] Identi.ca
text:
thanks for reviewing this!

we already had the first point:

http://tos-dr.info/#identi-ca

we will process your other points as soon as we work through our
backlog a little bit.

On Wed, Oct 3, 2012 at 10:12 PM, Andy Kaplan-Myrth <andy@kaplan-myrth.ca> wrote:
> Identi.ca is a federated social network using StatusNet software. Their site
> TOS are based on the original WordPress TOS.
>
> Good:
> All content is under the Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 licence, so it's
> openly available to use.
> No name requirements
> You can delete your account
> Privacy policy states that private information (including your email
> address, phone number, and private messages) will not be shared with other
> users, business partners or the public.
>
> Bad:
> All content is under the Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 licence, so it's
> openly available to use, including the service using your content.
>
> My own overall assessment is that it's a very fair TOS: while it allows the
> service to make use of user content, they can only do so on the same terms
> that anybody else can use the content. The Privacy Policy is solid as well.
>
> --
> www.tos-dr.info // www.twitter.com/tosdr // www.github.com/didnotread
> ---
> You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups
> "Terms of Service; Didn't Read" group.
> To post to this group, send email to tosdr@googlegroups.com.
> To unsubscribe from this group, send email to
> tosdr+unsubscribe@googlegroups.com.
> Visit this group at http://groups.google.com/group/tosdr?hl=en.
> For more options, visit https://groups.google.com/groups/opt_out.
>
>
